title: Mourning the death of Michael V. Cooper, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION mourning the death of Michael V. Cooper, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is with great sorrow and deep regret that  this  Legislative
Body  records  the passing of Michael V. Cooper, noting the significance
of his purposeful life and accomplishments; and
  WHEREAS, Michael V. Cooper distinguished himself in his profession and
by his sincere dedication and substantial contribution to the welfare of
his community; and
  WHEREAS, Born August 23, 1958, in Beckley, West Virginia,  Michael  V.
Cooper  was  a  dedicated educator and beloved Assistant Coach at Geneva
High School; he was a noble man who touched the lives of so many; having
had a passion for football led him to coach for over 28 years  where  he
played a tremendous role in the Geneva football family; and
  WHEREAS,  Along  with  coaching  Geneva  High  School football he also
coached youth football, both girls' indoor and outdoor track as well  as
girls' basketball; and
  WHEREAS,  A  proud  veteran  member of the Geneva High School coaching
staff, Michael V. Cooper played a central role in the Panthers' New York
State championship season in 2006; and
  WHEREAS, Michael V. Cooper was a Certified History  Teacher;  he  also
took  on the challenging role of leading the school's Structured Studies
program which includes students on long-term, in-school suspension; and
  WHEREAS, Often described as a big teddy bear with  a  presence  larger
than  life,  Michael  V. Cooper established a relationship with students
and players that could not be measured; he was influential  as  well  as
admired throughout the Geneva community; and
  WHEREAS,  A  devoted member of the Geneva Football Boosters Club and a
proud member of the Free and  Accepted  Masons  Humanity  Lodge  406  in
Lyons,  Michael V.  Cooper's commitment to excellence, and his spirit of
humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including charita-
ble and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Michael V. Cooper is survived by his wife, Susan Wilkes Coop-
er; his children: Colin (Marli Gringeri), Bryan, Andrew, Alyssa and  her
children,  Quinton  and  Dominick; his parents, Wallace and Gale Cooper;
siblings, Wally (Ronette) Cooper, Debbie (Ed) Compson,  William  Cooper,
Belinda (Brian Driscoll) Cooper and Tina Cooper; father-in-law and moth-
er-in-law,  Frank and Doris Wilkes; brother-in-law, David (Lori) Wilkes;
and sister-in-law, Sandy (Mike) Bajdas; as well as several nieces, neph-
ews, many extended family members and wonderful friends; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion,  and  comforted by a loving family, Michael V. Cooper leaves
behind a legacy which will long endure the  passage  of  time  and  will
remain  as  a  comforting  memory  to all he served and befriended; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn  the death of Michael V. Cooper, distinguished citizen and devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Michael V. Cooper.
